messages.subject: Live and Learn Unschooling Conference Update
messages.msgSnippet: We registered our 50th family for the Live and Learn Unschooling Conference today! So far we have over 180 people coming from all over the US and several from
messages.messageBody:
We registered our 50th family for the Live and Learn Unschooling Conference
today! So far we have over 180 people coming from all over the US and several
from Canada!

The conference will be held August 27 through 29 at the Marriott Hotel in
Peabody, Massachusetts, just 15 miles north of Boston.

Speakers will include Sandra Dodd, Anne Ohman, Pam Larricchia, Ben Lovejoy,
authors Barbara Sher and Valerie Fitzenreiter, FUN Books owner Billy Greer, and
more.

Some of the Funshops that will be available are Making Fairies, Wire Jewelry,
Geocaching, Ham Radio, Raising Guide Dog puppies, American Sign Language,
and, because we'll be right next door to Salem, Witches. (There'll be many more!)
The Family Resource Center will be bringing in Museum Educators from all
over the area to do fun things with us throughout the weekend.

There will be a storyteller, Beth Toolan, and a Children's Music performer,
Robin Blair. We'll be holding the world premiere of Stirling, a movie written,
acted by, and made by homeschooled teens.

PLEASE COME! I think the conference is going to be a blast. Deadline for
Early Bird conference rates is June 1st. The web site should have a big update at
the beginning of next week. Please pass this along to anyone you think will be
interested.

Kathryn Baptista, Conference Wizard


Come to the Live and Learn Unschooling Conference August 27-29 in Peabody, MA!
For more information, go to www.LiveandLearnConference.org


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Live and Learn Unschooling Conference Update
messages.msgSnippet: We ve had lots of struggles working out things with Paypal, but now we re all set! Because of the struggles some of you had trying to register and pay, we re
messages.messageBody:
We've had lots of struggles working out things with Paypal, but now we're all
set! Because of the struggles some of you had trying to register and pay,
we're extending the offer of a free gift at check-in when you register by April 1.

The Live and Learn Unschooling Conference will be held August 27-29 at the
Marriott Hotel in Peabody, MA. We already have folks registered from California
to Toronto to South Carolina. Come join us!

For more information, go to www.LiveandLearnConference.org

Kathryn Baptista


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Live and Learn Unschooling Conference Update

messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/25/2004 3:36:20 PM Mountain Standard Time,
KathrynJB@... writes:
There's more info on presenters, a few details on program, and a few
exhibitors who are confirmed, etc., and now you can register! Go to
www.LiveandLearnConference.org-=-


The photo of me is taken by Holly and we might send a different one later,
but my shirt matched the truck and so...

And I hope link can be changed to sandradodd.com/unschooling (please,
Kathryn) at some point, though this one is second best!

Sandra

messages.subject: Live and Learn Unschooling Conference Update
messages.msgSnippet: Hi folks! I wanted to let you all know that we have an update on the Live and Learn Unschooling Conference site. There s more info on presenters, a few details
messages.messageBody:
Hi folks! I wanted to let you all know that we have an update on the Live and
Learn Unschooling Conference site.

There's more info on presenters, a few details on program, and a few
exhibitors who are confirmed, etc., and now you can register! Go to
www.LiveandLearnConference.org

The conference is the third Annual Live and Learn Unschooling conference,
with the first two having been held in Columbia, SC. The conference will take
place at the Peabody Marriott August 27-29, 2004, and will welcome all ages.

Please e-mail me with any questions, but please know I'll be out of town for
a few days as my partner's mom has had a heart attack.

Thanks,
Kathryn Baptista, Conference Coordinator


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
